WorkItem.Description:
Error: Unhandled Error in Rawr 
Code: 2007    
Category: ParserError       
Message: 2007 An error has occurred.     
File:      
Line: 8     
Position: 45     
 
Source File: http://elitistjerks.com/rawr.php
Line: 35
 
Happens in both IE and Firefox.
WorkItem.Summary: [Base] Does not load due to a parser error

Comments.Message: I would have to agree in part since I'm able to load however none of the items are showing. I JUST posted an update to the item cache and when I tried coping those files into the Silverlight saved variable folder, it didn't load for that either.
Hina's ItemSource.xml committed is broken, he's fixing it now
Its fixed with his newer files, we'll post a new version this evening to correct it

Meanwhile, if you are having this problem and want to continue using Rawr:

1) Click the Source Code Tab on this page (open it in a new window if you can)
2) Click Change Set 55989
3) Click "Rawr4/Rawr.Silverlight.Web/ClientBin/ItemSource.xml" link (not the view diff)
4) Click Download and save the Zip File
5) Then go into the zip file and look for .\Rawr4\Rawr.Silverlight.Web\ClientBin\ItemSource.xml
6) Extract that file and put it into your Silverlight Cache (make sure you don't have Rawr open) at C:\users\<account>\AppData\LocalLow\Microsoft\Silverlight\is\ and then there will be a bunch of weird random letter names. If you use your Search Box and put in "ItemSource.xml" that should tell you the directory where it needs to go. If you see more than one, replace all of them.
7) Go back to the EJ web link for Rawr and it should open now

Still broken for me, with the same error.  The ItemSource.xml file specified is not found in my "C:\Users\<account>\AppData\LocalLow\Microsoft\Silverlight\is" folder.

I have a sneaking suspicion that this is an issue local to me.  Is there some kind of "master" Silverlight cache of Rawr3/4 that I can nuke to start fresh?  Silverlight Rawr has been problematic for me from the get-go.

Resolved.  Turns out, Windows was not being entirely truthful when it claimed to have updated Silverlight to the latest version.  Went directly to the Silverlight website and was immediately prompted to update.  Fun.

All set, now. Thanks!

To clarify for other users, <account> should be replaced with your Windows Login name. Like Jody or bobby_jones or whatever.

and ItemSource.xml won't be in the \is directory, it's gonna be like 3-4 directories down from that in those oddly named folders.

I'm glad you were able to resolve the issue by updating Silverlight, McC.
